name: 6-[bis(5-ethylfuran-2-yl)methyl]-7-nitro-2,3-dihydro-1,4-benzodioxine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2671
Reason: The molecular structure of 6-[bis(5-ethylfuran-2-yl)methyl]-7-nitro-2,3-dihydro-1,4-benzodioxine consists of a benzodioxine ring, a nitro functional group, and two ethylfuran groups. The melting point of the base structure, 2,3-dihydro-1,4-benzodioxine, is approximately -10.5 degrees Celsius. The nitro group can increase the melting point due to its electronegativity and potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated to contribute +40 degrees. The ethylfuran groups, which are polar and contain a heterocyclic ring, can also increase the melting point due to their ability to form hydrogen bonds, estimated to contribute +60 degrees. The presence of two ethylfuran groups can lead to synergistic effects, amplifying the increase in melting point beyond the sum of individual contributions.
